DefaultEvent.Description: "Splendid!" The Travel-Writer snaps his journal shut like a trap. "The Cumaean Canal next, I think."
DefaultEvent.Name: A next chapter

ChildBranches.Name: Give the Travel-Writer passage
ChildBranches.Description: A hundred and fifty echoes, you say? Why not?

DefaultEvent.Description: The August Travel-Writer frowns sharply at you. "What a pity," he says. "I shan't hold a grudge, captain. My work will do you justice." He gathers his trunk from below deck and departs.
DefaultEvent.Name: Taken in good grace

ChildBranches.Name: Refuse to aid the Travel-Writer
ChildBranches.Description: He can find someone else to ferry him about.

Description: The August Travel-Writer flips through his notebook while on your deck. "Awful thing, that murder. Commonplace here, I suppose. Fortunately, my interview was illuminating and my business on the Mourn is complete. We can depart. I've another port to visit, if you'd care for another hundred and fifty echoes."
Name: The August Travel-Writer's Request
